Reviews.Title: “My new Marriott choice for San Diego business trips”
Reviews.Author: AmyandChuck2010
Reviews.Content: My company is based in La Jolla so I have stayed at the La Jolla Marriott for many years. In my opinion, that hotel has gone down hill over the last 2 years so I wanted to try another property that was still reasonably close by. Only 5 minutes farther up I-5 North is the Del Mar Marriott. It is so much nicer than the one in the La Jolla. It has been completely updated, and the rooms are very clean & spacious. The concierge lounge is outstanding with a very wide variety of hot & cold foods for both breakfast & dinner. I did not use the pool area, but it looked really nice. I don't like that the parking garage isn't attached to the hotel because you have to walk completely around the building so I deducted a star. It is also shared by an office building so there are many reserved spaces that hotel guests can't use. The parking is cheaper than many hotels at only $10/night. There was discount applied to my bill so that may only apply to higher Marriott status levels. The hotel is in a very quiet business park area so I had no problem with noise either outside of the hotel (traffic/people) or inside either. This also means that there are few services within walking distance, but there are lots of sidewalks if you want to walk or run. It is a straight shot down Carmel Valley Road (about 5-10 minutes depending on traffic and the lights) to get to the beach and the cute little Del Mar restaurant area. I highly recommend eating at Jakes Del Mar but you have to make a reservation. They have the best seafood but it's definitely pricey. In short, if you want a Marriott property near La Jolla/Del Mar, this is by far the nicest one. It's great for business but would also be a good base for a San Diego vacation. If you need to be closer to downtown, the Marriott Gaslamp District is the best of any Marriott property in all of San Diego, however it is also usually the most expensive. If you're looking to use points for vacation, definitely choose the Gaslamp. It is ultra modern, hip and in a spectacular location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property.”
Reviews.Author: Greg M
Reviews.Content: The property is very clean and the rooms appear new. Although I did not visit the pool area, it looked very nice from my window and appeared to have a good social scene. The hotel is about a twenty minute walk (5 minute drive) from the Del Mar Town Center, which has some good dining and shopping options. The property isn't really far from things to do, but you pretty much have to drive if you want a good selection. Downtown Del Mar and the ocean is about a 12-15 minute drive. I had a few relatively minor service failures, but although annoying at the time they didn't really taint my view of the overall stay. The Hampton Inn next door is a bit better value and seemed clean (no parking fee, free breakfast and slightly lower rate) but the Marriott definitely has a nicer property.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel but Very Noisy Pool Area”
Reviews.Author: Enjoy2travel
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business meeting in the area so I had a couple of days to relax. The room was pleasant and nice. There was no shampoo when we checked into our room, but they provided it almost immediately. Parking is expensive though. The weather was perfect to sit outside by the lounge and pool area but instead of having a quiet place to read a book, the background music was VERY loud and at times brassy! Not all of us are hard of hearing. I changed spots 3 times to find a "quieter" place but it was all the same - LOUD! So I had to go back inside to find a quiet place (our room!) but would have loved to be sitting outside with such perfect weather.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business”
Reviews.Author: KPhagan
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for a Business Trip. When you include valet or parking and the always expensive room service it got to be quite pricey on the expense report. It's in a business park with not much to see or do in walking distance, but rent a convertible and your just minutes from anything and everything you'd want to see in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Chain Hotel - Expensive for the Indifferent Service”
Reviews.Author: TB2445
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in advance of a business meeting the following day. I checked in around 11:30 pm on a mid-week evening. The room was average and the A/C didn't function properly (either too hot or cold and loud besides). I only got one of the two wake-up calls I arranged. It was expensive for the one night. I would not recommend this hotel - there are simply too many other options but this was the only property located near my appointment and was convenient for a late check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Typical large chain hotel, very nice but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: jwillim
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I stayed here while attending a soccer tournament; the hotel was chosen by the team, and I would probably have selected a cheaper place if traveling on my own, but the hotel is super nice and easy to get to from I5. The address says San Diego, but is still about 10-15 minutes north of what a tourist would consider "San Diego". So if you're looking for a place NOT in the hustle & bustle of downtown but close by, this is a good place to stay. Despite the fact we were there for a soccer tournament and there were other teams staying there, it did not seem overly loud or busy, even for a holiday weekend. One drawback is everything costs extra. Self-parking $15 or valet parking $20. Internet $12. Plus all the taxes etc really increased the price of the room. Parking garage was decent but does have a height limit. Pool looked very nice but we didn't have time to use it. My room was the farthest from the elevator on an upper floor, so maybe that is why it was so quiet...no one wandering back & forth past my room! The inside of the room was pleasant & clean, and the bed was so very comfortable! Nice large bathroom, enough room for both my daughter & I to spread out our toiletries!

Reviews.Title: “Not for families.”
Reviews.Author: Selectivetraveler22
Reviews.Content: Ok for solo biz travel but neither inviting nor accommodating for family.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend rate”
Reviews.Author: SoCalMark
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here Friday - Sunday in late October. This property serves more as a business hotel with Mon - Fri business, we felt the weekend crowd was quite light and he hotel was quiet. We were impressed with every stafff member that we came into contact with, all very friendly and professional. The hotel is located just east of I-5 and does not have an ocean view. You will need a car to get around as the beach, downtown Del Mar, and other local attractions are not walkable. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: CdelP
Reviews.Content: One of the hotels I stay in when I am in San Diego for business. The rooms are clean and beds are very comfortable. The rooms are generally quiet. It's not the hotel's fault when the guests forget to lower their voice while walking down the hallway at an ungodly hour. The reception staff are very helpful and tend to remember you when you've stayed a few times. I can't recommend the restaurant though... spotty service, food tends to be a bit salty and expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Just a standard Marriott”
Reviews.Author: ramoneur
Reviews.Content: I staid there for 5 nights, during a business meeting. The name of the hotel (Del Mar) is a bit misleading, as you cannot expect to see the Pacific from your room. This is located in the Del Mar area, a few miles away from the sea, in a business area. However, itâ€™s only a few miles away from Solana Beach, where you will find restaurants and other activities. The hotel is OK, free internet in public areas, but 12 USD in your room. The breakfast buffet is outrageously expensive (20 USD + tip) for a very limited selection (the usual scrambled eggs, sausages/bacon, potatoesâ€¦). I did not try the restaurant. Same feeling at the bar regarding prices. In a few words, it is good for business (despite the disappointing location), and to be avoided for vacation, as there is absolutely no charm.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for holidays”
Reviews.Author: Sabine P
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel for four days and my Kids and we loved it. The Swimmingpool and the jacuzzi were very clean. We loved the absolutly gorgeus soft beds like sleeping in a cloud. The fitness room has new machines. It is very close to the beach. Parking is 18 Dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: dgreene99
Reviews.Content: The Del Mar Marriott has been beautifully updated with the latest Marriott bedding and is very, very comfortable... in fact I ordered a couple of the pillows for home... for business it's excellent with a very nice concierge lounge with breakfast and light dinner... the gym has the best treadmills and cycles with TV's' as well as weights and opens to the pool area... very nice pool area with outdoor heaters if needed... I've stayed here many times for work and would highly recommend it. Note: daily parking is $20 at the writing of this review.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Edye
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 had a great 5 night stay. I was concerned about 4 in a room and the hotel was sold out so 2 rooms were not an option. They accommodated us in a large handicapped room which worked out just fine! The pool area is as lovely as other guests say, the food is great and who doesn't love a sushi happy hour! We paid the self park fee for the convenience factor and have no regrets. Location is great for all San Diego activities, especially the amazing town of Del Mar!

Reviews.Title: “Kinda Bland”
Reviews.Author: babbilu
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a romantic property with architecturally-significant touches - this ain't your cup of tea. This hotel literally screams "business traveler." And that's just perfect, seeing that I was there on business. The staff was quick, courteous and efficient; check-in took 2 minutes max; restaurant and bar area served good, solid fare and drinks; rooms are clean and spacious; beds comfortable. What else would a business traveler need? Couple of side quirks: 1) No safe in the room. Somewhat strange for a hotel catering to business travelers. Safes do not take up too much space, folks. 2) But they did have a minibar in the room - and it was turned off and completely empty. Either my persona did not effuse Marriott with confidence in my solvency, or minibars are "out" at Marriott as permanent room features. Here is a suggestion: take out the non-functioning minibar and replace it with....wait.... you guessed it! A safe! 2) The hallways are a bit claustrophobia-inducing - and I mean really, really narrow. But, I suppose, this cannot be helped. 3) As I mentioned before, bar and restaurant are decent. Can get really busy and crowded real fast, as your fellow hapless corporate warriors converge after day's meetings and presentations, so get there early. Did not seem to affect the service, though. 4) No free wi-fi, amigos, but that's par for the course for all Marriott properties.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonLady
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at this hotel for 3 days in July. When I made the reservation, they told me they only had "Concierge Rooms" left to book, which are more expensive, but I had to be in San Diego so I booked the room. The room is actually the same room everyone else has, but you have access to the 11th floor "Concierge Room" for breakfast and afternoon appetizers. That is the only difference between booking a regular room and a concierge room. The breakfast was very good, and the afternoon appetizers were nice too. Not sure if it is worth the upgraded price. The hotel room was very clean, bed was comfortable, bathroom very large, parking in the garage was $18.00 per day and valet parking was $24.00 per day. The Doubletree across the street had free parking so I was a bit irked by the parking fees. Also, the Doubletree had a shuttle that would take you around. That was nice as the Marriott didn't have one. My colleagues were staying at the Doubletree so I was able to take advantage of the shuttle. These hotels are really in a business section, so you need a car to take you anywhere you may want to go. We did get to go to the beach near the 15th Street area - lots of restaurants and shops in that area and it is about 15 minutes from the hotel. There is no free wi-fi although they did have two computers in the lobby you could use for free. I didn't try the restaurant in the hotel, but many people living in San Diego told me that it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel - Incredible service!!!”
Reviews.Author: DaphneBernstein
Reviews.Content: I am a Marriott platinum elite member and a very loyal customer of Marriott. I was in San Diego for business and had stayed here one night because the location was close to my office. I have stayed at many Marriott properties and was incredibly impressed with this particular hotel because of the warm and friendly service that I had received during my stay. Everyone from valet to the concierge lounge was helpful, polite, and called me by name. I met Amy Fradsham, the Director of Rooms Operations, while I was checking in. She took care of some reservation details for me and armed me with some tips to make my stay most enjoyable. She presented her card to me and offered the personal service to make all of my future reservations for me. The hotel is beautiful. There is a wonderful contempory California cuising restaruant with a really hip bar that opens up into a nice outdoor patio. This hotel is located in a business park district but offers the feel of a spa resort, so it is a great place to bring your spouse when you are here for business. The rooms are standard size and are very clean and comfortable. The beds are dressed with standard Marriott bedding, so you will be sure to have a good night's sleep. There is easy access to the freeway, but it isquiet and relaxing. This is a typicval Marriott hotel, but what makes it extra special is the exceptional service. I will certainly return here.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it!”
Reviews.Author: my_red_dress
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice and I like the fact that they accept dogs. Close to stuff like restaurants and the race track. Would stay again. Was busy due to a wedding and a party at the pool. Gotta expect that for the July 4th weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pretty pool, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Bixter212
Reviews.Content: My only complaints are: They charge you $18 for self park and $24 for valet, then $12.95 for internet access, which really adds to the price of the room by the time you're done. Also, they gave me a room right next to the elevator and in the morning I was kept awake by the sound of the elevators going up and down. When I complained I was told that my profile didn't say I wanted to be away from the elevators and machinery.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, expensive restaurant”
Reviews.Author: nuggets00
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night while on a business trip and I had a pleasant stay. I found the room design to be fairly bland, but that's subjective. The hotel is located in a business park area and seems to be geared towards business travelers. The good: Hotel looks fairly new and in good shape, pool area is nice and includes a hot tub, restaurant serves good food and has a good drink selection, bar is pretty busy in the evenings, room was good size, staff was friendly, wireless internet was fast, bath amenities were nice. The OK: I found the food and wine in the hotel restaurant to be pretty expensive compared to other hotels that I've stayed in, they charge for wireless internet and finding the correct network to use took a little time (I think they had three different stations broadcasting but only one allowed you to sign up for internet). The bad: nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of fine print”
Reviews.Author: Befink
Reviews.Content: On the surface it seems like a good value but includes little but the room. Parking costs $18 a day, breakfast is not included and is overpriced, and wifi is the usual gouge. My tip is to decline their parking charge and park on the street just below the hotel (they will tell you about it if you ask). I had no trouble finding a spot there at any hour. If you do, there are many empty business parks in the area and a Double-Tree hotel across the street which always provides free parking for its guests. I was also annoyed that the bell-hops did a great job unloading our car onto a cart, then left the cart in the lobby instead of bringing it to our room. Also took the front desk two attempts to remove the parking charge from my bill even though it sounded like no problem the first time.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was superb.”
Reviews.Author: Mica36
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here. The staff was exceptional, and extremely accommodating to all of our requests. Every time we passed by the lobby, they made sure to say hi, and always made sure we were taken care of. The location is a little out of the way if you want to be near downtown, but we knew this going in, and it wasn't a problem.

Reviews.Title: “SO SO”
Reviews.Author: aman27
Reviews.Content: We stayed the week before Presidents day and found the location to be not optimal. Our first night we had a terrible Mattress that completely caved in the middle and ruined the day. The front desk was accomodating and immediately switched our rooms and provided Concierge access as compensation. Overall the room was clean and comfortable and close to Torrey Pines Park for some nice hikes. There is not a whole lot in walking distance to the hotel as its located in a business park. Parking is expensive at $18/self park and $25/valet i think .. but we parked around the corner on the street. If you have a car I would recommend the Hampton Inn across the street with Free Parking.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything yet a nice and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: BPBValencia
Reviews.Content: Although the restaurant and bar are under a major renovation, my wife and I really enjoyed our two-day get away. Some tips for a first time visitor: 1) Park on the street and save $18/night parking charge. 2) You can drive 4 blocks to the movie theatre and a variety of shopping and restaurants or shop at the Ralph's nearby and use the refrigerators in the rooms (for those of you who couldn't find it, look under the t.v. in the 'dresser' drawer on the right side) and rent a movie on the t.v. 3) The hot tub and pool area are very nice---bring plastic cups and enjoy a few beverages by the pool. 4) There is a Ruth's Chris steak house w/in walking distance. 5) Downtown S.D. is only a scenic 20 min. drive away. I would like to thank John at the front desk for making our stay even better than we could have hoped for. Overall, we really enjoyed the Marriott and their customer service and professional attitudes.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Marriott Properties!”
Reviews.Author: destined4joy
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, exceptional property with the quality and consistency that is Marriott. The staff were friendly, the room was very clean, quiet, comfortable and one of the best Marriott properties where I have stayed. Definitely worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Not a great Marriott Experience”
Reviews.Author: RoamingMenehune
Reviews.Content: Although conveniently located for meetings in Del Mar, the hotel is not very nice. The upholstery in my room didn't seem very clean, it was dark and smelled a bit funny. I arrived early Sunday evening night and the restaurant was closed so they said the only option was room service since I didn't have a car (nearest restaurants were 1+ miles up the hill). Room service menu was not terribly appetizing (who wants a steak or salmon dinner in their room?!) so I ended up ordering a kid's plate of pasta (which they initially messed up) and a side of vegetables for $25! Not to mention my room rate was $200+, though perhaps that was a corporate rate issue. I would not recommend staying here unless you have meetings in the area, and in that case, there are other hotel options that might be better.

Reviews.Title: “Typical great Marriott service”
Reviews.Author: kativosk
Reviews.Content: This particular location would be perfect for people doing business in the immediate area. It is not near the beaches, but the friendliness and courtesy of the staff made up for it. There is a nice pool with cabanas as well as a great workout room. And my husband described the beds as the most comfortable he's ever slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for business meetings”
Reviews.Author: APPMum
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip with breakfast meetings and evening outings as well. Great room service, courteous and helpful staff. Good restauarnt but limited room service timings nad vegetarian options. Still recommend for the overall facilities

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: the2roadtrippers
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel. The staff was helpful, the room was beautiful and clean, the pool area was like paradise. Just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Graet Location & Sservice”
Reviews.Author: BTOWN72008
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Del Mar, Ca. Marriott for three nights. We were in town for a Girls Softball tournament. I couldn't be happier with this hotel. The staff was extremely accommodating and willing to help any time requested. This normally is considered a Business hotel due to the location. You have close access to the 5 freeway and the 56 Freeway. The pool was great for the kids and very relaxing for the adults. It has a very modern decor and the rooms are spacious and will decorated with eco friendly rooms. The beds and the bedding were very nice. We did not use the in house parking due to the $18 a day fee, but found ample parking right outside the hotel. There is a shopping center close by with a grocery store and various restaurants. The beach is a short drive away. Even though we had a pool view you could see the Freeway from our room but not hear it. Cudos to the management for running this property. We will definitely stay there again. We loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Too many things went wrong...”
Reviews.Author: miamitola
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night in May 2010. By using a search engine we got a good price $89 for the night and after taxes it was a little over $100. We arrived one hour after the time we selected and our room still was not ready. After standing around for a few minutes looking annoyed, the employee at the counter offered us two free breakfasts for the next morning. Pros: - inexpensive - good happy hour prices (everyday - even weekends) - pool area looked nice - nice gym w/free water - flat screen tv in room Cons: - $18 a night garage parking (we parked on the street before you enter the hotel and saved the $18) - small rooms - no free wifi - breakfast buffet (even though it was free) was not good ($20 a person) - no refrigerator in the room - the hotel lost power 2 times - WORST OF ALL - my husband was taking a shower and the water stopped - just stopped in the middle of the shower. After about 2 minutes it began to spit out of the shower head again. I tried the sink faucet, and it too had dried up.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Del Mar Nice but expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: jelligirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to the Del Mar Beach area and La Jolla Torrey Pines hiking area. It is a good location for north county beaches, and exploring beautiful areas of La Jolla, Solana Beach, Encinitas Beach but far (35 min) from downtown SD. It's more peaceful in the Del Mar/Marriott area with plenty to see and do than in downtown. The self parking charge was $18/day with in and out privileges. However, behind the hotel there is a cul-de-sac which has FREE street parking. I had no problems finding a space there and it was a quick walk -very short distance to the hotel. By the way, I got a $65 night deal on Priceline for this property and was quite pleased with my stay. Wi-fi was avalable for a fee. Free PC terminals for internet in the lobby with 30 min limit.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: TravelsABunch
Reviews.Content: I, for sure, disagree with other reviewer that this is a standard Marriott. This hotel is much nicer than most Marriott I have stayed in. The ambiance is quite refreshing yet simple, the rooms are more upscale yet very comfortable, the service is slightly better and most importantly, this hotel goes out of its to please customers. Exercise room is very nice with complimentary bottled water and headsets, the pool is great for a business hotel, the restaurant is very good and the in/out bar is awesome. I loved every minute of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice but high parking fee”
Reviews.Author: kiwifuz
Reviews.Content: The lobby of the hotel is beautiful. The staff is friendly. The rooms themselves were fine. Not a ton of space but adequate. The restaurant menu sounded great. The bar had some local craft beers on tap. The outdoor patio area was pretty. My biggest complaint is the $18 parking fee and the dark somewhat isolated sidewalk to & from the parking a garage. My other issue was that the rooms could have used some, I guess I'll call it maintenance type cleaning. The carpet had dirty spots, & the throw on the end of the one bed that had one had strange stains. From what we found the "Business Center" was a few time-limited computers in the lobby that had issues accessing work related sites. I like the Del Mar area that this hotel is in because it's not the "rest" of Del Mar near the fairgrounds. What I wasn't necessarily fond of is getting in & out of the hotel due to the orientation of the hotel on the street. But everything in this business park area has the same issue. We ended up at this hotel because we bid on a 3 1/2 star level on Priceline rather than our usual 3 star in this area. The 3 star is the Double Tree that, while not as "pretty" and not featuring what seems to be an outstanding restaurant, doesn't charge for parking. You'd think these places being almost directly across the street from each other parking would be either paid or not at both. Odd. I'd stay again for the right price, but I'd prefer the Double Tree that has free parking and seems cleaner. Anyone can visit the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special -- standard Marriott business hotel”
Reviews.Author: TreasuryGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on business for $125 but it was $184 with parking, taxes, etc. Overall, it was fine, but certainly nothing special. As other travelers have noted, the parking was too expensive and there was no free internet. It was nice that there was a computer and printer near the front desk to get my boarding pass for my flight out. The hotel is on an office park drive near I-5, so it was pretty easy access. Fine for business but probably not an attraction for families. The room was extremely clean. It was about as clean as I have ever seen a room. I only had breakfast at the restaurant and although I was only one of about three people in the place, it took forever for an omelet. And the waiter disappeared for about 10 minutes. Not something you want when you are on a business trip. My colleagues came down during my meal and we had to go find the waiter (chatting at the front desk) to get our bill so we could head out for our meeting. Overall, the Marriott was pretty standard. Kudos on the cleanliness but pretty darn average everywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Mariott”
Reviews.Author: Pinoy123
Reviews.Content: Pleasant experience. No complaints except the pricey parking as others noted. Top class restaurant on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “A Poorly Managed Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thefahrm
Reviews.Content: My family and I experienced several problems with this hotel that began on check-in. 1. Following check-in, my daughter, staying in another room, called to say that there was a persistant and load "beeping" noise in her room. I went to her her room and sure enough, there was. I complained to the front desk. They said they would send an engineer. 30-45 minutes elapsed, she called the front desk, and shortly there this second call, someone came a resolved the problem. 2. This hotel has something called the "Just Like Home" Linen Resue Program. According to a card in my room: "We change bed linens every third day and upon each checkout for conservation purposes. However, we are delighted to meet your needs by changing bed linens upon request. Simply place this card on your pillow each day you would like your bed linens changed." Nowhere on this card does it state that the bed will not be made and that the room will not be picked up, but that is what happens at this hotel. I didn't use the card because I didn't care if I got clean linens, but I expected the bed to be made. When I complained about this, they sent a supervisor to my room to ask me if I really wanted to have the room made up. Finally, the room was picked up. I've had better service at much less expensive facilities, and would never stay at this hotel again based on their "Just Like Home" policy. When I stay in a nice hotel, I don't want it to be just like home.

Reviews.Title: “Best price for the area”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaParislover
Reviews.Content: Very clean and accomidating. Nice room with free bottled water. 2 free computers to use in the lobby. We booked the bed and breakfast rate of $70. thru Priceline. Breakfast buffet was wonderful. Wonderful location, but park yourself for free instead of in the valet at $14, per day.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great, some minor irritations”
Reviews.Author: tjbrooks
Reviews.Content: We had a decent stay at the Del Mar Marriott. Upon check-in we got a room that was extremely smoky at a non-smoking hotel. They should have caught that before freeing up the room. They put us in a slightly bigger room afterwards. The check-in staff was rather disinterested. Another annoyance was the mandatory $16/day parking. After that, it was a very nice hotel, nice room, free coffee, free infused water in the lobby (compostable cups, thumbs up!). I followed up with the management about my minor issues (they sent me a survey), and they responded personally and very politely with a couple small comps if we returned. Very good customer service after the first issues. Lounge was NOT open on the weekends (Marriott Gold, albeit on a Priceline stay). Be careful on Sundays as they have a pool party with fairly loud music. Fun people watching there.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel--just okay”
Reviews.Author: mndrwatt
Reviews.Content: This is my first time at a Marriott Hotel, and I was looking forward to it. I do not often travel on business. I was pleased that my company put me here. Mostly when I travell with family we stay in Quality Inn or Best Western or the like. I expected a better kind of place than those. The lobby is nicer, and the bed was very good. But otherwise, it mostly seems more exppensive. Everything is extra cost. Brakfast, $12. Internet, parking, all extra. I am glad I am not paying. And the room wasn't that superior. Also, the alraarm clock awoke me at 4 in the morning. I did not appreciate that. For the information of tourists, the location is not good. It is in a business park, far from the city.

Reviews.Title: “Your basic marriott room with no bells and whistle”
Reviews.Author: cliu
Reviews.Content: my teenage son and i spent just one night at the marriott while paying only $75 on priceline...after taxes it was about $92 which was a fantastic deal for del mar area . i was expecting much worse after i have read some reviews on trip advisor but to our surprise, it was very good. we had 2 queen beds and they were very comfortable and i loved their huge square pillows...they weren't too soft is it was great. they had a flat screen in the room, the washroom had an old fashion bathtub instead of a deep jacuzzi or walk in shower. one thing that bothered me was that there was no safe in the room, which i found to be odd. parking is $16 self park or $22 valet . we managed to park on the street for free for one night so we saved some $$$. we didn't use the pool, but it looked quite nice and large. i would recommend the hotel if you get a good deal on expedia or priceline but i don't think it's worth the$165 that they post on their hotel website. it's an absolute great deal if you can get it under $100 through priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay.. Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: flyboy1980
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Marriott Del Mar. Good location, decent price, and an average/good stay. Nothing Special, nothing bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for value”
Reviews.Author: stcapp
Reviews.Content: Considering the price of this hotel, things like internet access and parking should be complimentary, but they are NOT. These days, most hotels include both, so I can't imagine why this hotel doesn't - considering as a hotel it's nothing special. Then, there's only a single overpriced restaurant on property so if you don't happen to have a car, you have to hike to other locations to eat or suck it up to eat at their overpriced restaurant. Their "business center" is a couple of computers in the lobby and are very often occupied by the kids that stay at the hotel, so if you want to do business things you have to do like check in and get your boarding passes you have to ask the staff to do something about the kids. Easier said than done. All in all, they need to work on some things before I would ever stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Could be Better, Could be Worse...All Biz and pretty OK”
Reviews.Author: pulgadelmundo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is adequate...people tend to gush about marriotts but I have never been uber impressed by one yet...but this one overall was nice. It isn't that I didn't like ithe hotel and I would not cringe to stay there again. I guess the problem is I have stayed at the equally adaquate Double Tree across the street which is $30 less and gives you free cookies....(the Marriott does offer you refreshing grapefruit water which I dug) I purchased through Priceline for about 50ish + taxes aiming for a 3 star but they upgraded me to this 3.5 star property. The self-parking is $16 a day and Internet is an extra $12 bucks. The parking is shared with a business property which is a little bit of an unusual configuration..The rooms are smaller but have a lovely golden glow and were clean. They did allow me to check in around 12:30 and were quite pleasant. They offered me a "pool or canyon view". I choose pool . The gent said they usually have music till 11pm but I was gone till much later then that so it didn't matter. The pool is big, modern and fun... The restaurant at the hotel is on the foofy side...it has many wine accolades and such which made it pricey. There is lots of industrial/biotech biz in the area so I have a feeling they cater to industry expense acount lunches during the week...I will say there were plenty of good looking men around :) (torrey pines golf in SD weekend anyone?) My only issue was that the computers in the lobby had an issue using sites with calendars ( aka sites booking hotel rooms, air flights ans such).... If you are going to Torrey Pines, SD fair or Del Mar track...it is a solid choice

Reviews.Title: “The WORST experience”
Reviews.Author: taku143
Reviews.Content: We checked in on 23rd of April, for 4 nights at room #222. Here is where the nightmare started (no exaggeration, in fact it is a bit toned-down). On the night of the 24th, we decided to rent a humidifier from the hotel, since the first night in the room was dry (a typical California night). At 12-midnight, the fire-alarm goes off. With the 11 months old baby crying in that terrible noise, we do our best to try to put off the alarm for about 5 min. A lady calls in (who cannot speak much English, and has no clue about the humidifier), and tells us that she is going to send someone over. A young man walks in the room, climbs on top of the bed with his SHOES ON, and struggles with the alarm for couple of minutes, then rips the alarm out the wall saying, "This is broken. I hope there's no fire from your room tonight, hehe." I, then realized that the fans in the room was not working, and the humidifier has fogged the room, and caused the alarm to "break." We were very unsatisfied and decided to tell the front desk about what had happened. The next morning, I walk up to the desk, and ask a young lady to pass on the message to the manager about the humidifier incident, and I was stunned by her response & attack. Young lady: Well, OBVIOUSLY, we cannot foresee the alarm to break. Why didn't you report the fan problem in the first place? Me: (Trying to figure out why she hasn't apologized ONCE, and why she is blaming the GUEST for not catching what is broken in the room) Uhh... could you please just pass on the message to your manager? We are very upset, and this is the first time in our lives that we made a complaint to a hotel (we have stayed at numerous hotels around the world, and this is by FAR the worst service). This is not what we've payed for. Young lady: I am glad to replace you to another room, if that's what you want. IF YOU HADN'T RENTED A HUMIDIFIER, THIS WOULD NEVER HAD HAPPENED. Me: (Trying to manage my anger from the rude tone, and how she tried to justify them not being responsible for the broken alarm REPEATEDLY) We will come back and discuss this, since my family needs some sleep. PLEASE pass on this message. Since we could not go back to the hotel until around 9PM that night, I called the hotel, and they told me that we were getting an upgrade to room #1022, and access to the Concierge Room. We were not please with the young lady, but we thought that the hotel was doing there best at that point. Early next morning, I tried to check the internet on the first floor, and the guy at the front was using one of the computers (out of two, and the other one was broken). It was not very pleasant having to wait for the WORKER to just sit there, browse through the internet. I did not complain about this, since we did not want to "rat" on this guy, but there was more to come. We go into the Concierge Room to get some breakfast on the last morning. The lady there, told us that our name was not on the list. I had to explain everything to the lady, and she understood. We were again, not very satisfied by this simple miscommunication within the hotel. When checking out of the hotel, the young guy at the front, had his hands in the pocket throughout our conversation. We have (again) never received this kind of service in our lives. The young workers at this hotel SERIOUSLY need a training. I would NEVER want to stay there, with that kind of service. Side note: We extended our stay in San Diego, but decided to stay at DoubleTree, and they did not have a great room, but the service was good (it stood out, after the stay at Marriott).

Reviews.Title: “Charges for nearly Everything”
Reviews.Author: InnerPeaceDesigns
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for Valentine's weekend for my husband and I. We have always stayed at the DoubleTree across the street, but, Mariott picked up our offer through Priceline. Hotel staff was nice enough to allow us to check in before 3 pm. I asked for a quiet room and was assured all the rooms were quiet (not true since we heard the DJ's music after 10 pm). I was quite shocked at the parking charge of $16.00 per night for overnight guests. There is VERY limited parking on a cul de sac street which is free. Also, the hotel charged $12.95 for 24 hours use of wireless Internet. I thought that maybe they would have free wireless in the lobby, but there was none. When I went to their business center to see if I could use the Internet, I was in disbelief to find that their "business center" was just a closet sized room with no door. Basically it was set up like phone cubicles. Some of the internet cords were pulled out of the wall. The rooms were nicely decorated but the beds were small for two adults. We had two double beds. I wouldn't come back to the Marriott because they charge for nearly everything. This is why I appreciate Doubletree - free parking, free wireless internet in the lobby, and a appropriately priced restaurant that actually serves good food.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: TANGOWB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here two nights last week. The restaurant, Arterra, was wonderful. Our room was suppose to have "no view", but we did have a slight view of the mountains to the west. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Had a great stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service but noisy”
Reviews.Author: joyofjoys
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights, and ended up in 3 different rooms as a result of being moved due to being able to hear every thing the persons in the next room were saying. There seemed to be a wedding going on and/or some other groups that made the hotel their party destination (strange, considering that its located in a corporate business park environment) so it was more due to my neighbors having five-ten people in their room at a time and socializing versus normal use. The Marriott staff was awesome and did everything they could to accommodate me. They had the fastest room service I've ever seen and the food was delicious. Aside from the check-in staff, the employees were top notch all the way. The beds were very comfortable and the room furnishings were up-to-date and clean. Internet worked flawlessly and was quite fast. The valet was terrible and didn't even leave his little podium to greet me or the gentlemen that pulled up behind me. After a while we both got out, unloaded our own luggage and traipsed over to the valet. He might have wanted us to park our own cars? The parking fee (self-park or valet) at this property is totally unjustified, they have more than enough land and its not as though its any where near downtown or the ocean. Another sad Marriott add-on just like charging for their internet service daily. Check-in was unreasonably slow considering there were 4 staff members and only 2 other people checking in. The first set of keys that I got didn't work and after lugging 500 lbs of luggage back down to get a set that did work, no one even offered to assist me going back up. I would definitely stay here again although next time I think I'll try the Marriott in LaJolla instead.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: 3soccermom
Reviews.Content: Our team booked a block of rooms together on the same floor for a soccer tournament, six weeks in advance. At arrival, many were told that since the hotel overbooked for the weekend, there were no rooms with double beds left and our option was a room with a king and a rollaway. This was unacceptable, as we all had multiple children staying with us. After over an hour of "discussion" with supervisors, most were placed in rooms, but all on different floors. Forgivable. Maid service was below average. Received clean towels and beds were made (after 4pm) but trash was not emptied. Also forgivable. On checkout day, no statement was under my door and when I called, was told that there was "confusion". Went to front desk to see bill, which was calculated incorrectly. Waited while they fixed it. Again, forgivable. Just checked my credit card statement and was charged twice for different amounts. I called and was told there was a charge for the two nights we stayed under my husband's name and a charge for both nights under my name dated checkout day. That was the last straw that prompted me to write this review. While the hotel was nice, the service was not. I will stay at Marriott again, but definitely not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay at the Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: GingerGirlNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while visiting with friends and their new baby. It was a surprisingly lovely hotel. We had a nice room, beautiful view, a nice meal in the hotel and room service was great. It was also quiet which is nice because there were families with kids. We had very easy access to the highways and downtown San Diego. Great weekend getaway spot -- they have a lovely pool and outdoor firepits!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: talimoth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott from June 14th-16th. The room was small and was nothing special considering the price. The only benefit was that the location was good since we had plans to visit the Del Mar Fair on Sunday. We booked in advance on the Marriott website with a promotional offer and the bill was incorrect at check-out. It was fixed, but it was still an inconvenience. The next time I visit San Diego I will be staying at another property.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bedding!”
Reviews.Author: Hawaiiantraveler66
Reviews.Content: Why do we stay at a hotel... mostly to sleep. I have to say, this was one of the most comfortable beds I have slept on. It rates right up there with Westin's Heavenly bed. Room was nice and clean. Furnishings looked almost brand new. Front desk staff was pleasant and friendly. Everyone was professional but not snobby. One of the better hotels in greater San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: jackntomsmom
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for just one night at this property with my three small boys. We were spending a week in Carlsbad in a condo but we couldn't check into our condo until the next night, so we spent one night here before moving on. I got a little turned around on the way there and called for directions. The girl who answered the phone at their front desk was RUDE and unhelpful. I was fortunate to also have the same girl check us in... again, rude and looked at my offspring like they were contagious. I did let them totally raid her candy jar after that. I was shocked at what they charge for parking ($16 & $22 for valet), I've stayed in nice resorts and I felt that they were trying to be a four star hotel but missed the mark, however they were charging four star prices. The pool area was nice and truly the highlight of the stay. The valet gave us great directions to the town center for dinner which was great as well. We ordered room service in the morning and the food was sub par but the service was great. I wouldn't reccomend this hotel if you are traveling with your kids. The hotel is in a weird place, somewhat industrial. There are way too many great places around to waste your time or money on this Marriott in Del Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Satisfactory Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cycleboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mariott Del Mar for three nights while in town for sightseeing and visiting family. Found it to be very nice for the price I paid (booked through the Mariott website). A little off the beaten path for tourist activities and mostly geared to business travel, but a very well maintaied property, attentive staff and very comfy beds (especially the comforters). Only problem was a forgotten room service coffee order one morning.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location”
Reviews.Author: shario
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Del Mar Marriott for $87 per night on Priceline. I really disagree with the two-star rating that Trip Advisor is giving this hotel - it is at least a three-star hotel. It is much nicer than a Holiday Inn or similar hotel. This is the second time we have stayed here. This time, it was much busier than the last time. There were a lot of group events going on so the bar and restaurant were constantly crowded. That is a sign of the success of the hotel, of course. The restaurant, Arterra, seems to be extremely popular with more than just hotel guests. As far as the rooms are concerned, everything was fine - comfortable bed, rooms cleaned on time, nice amenities in the bathroom. One thing I really like about this hotel is the location. Although it seems unexciting - it is basically in the middle of a business park so is not a good choice if you don't have a car - it is only about a 15-20 minute drive to downtown San Diego and 10-15 minutes' drive to Del Mar, La Jolla and Solana Beach so you have the option to go in either direction for dinner, beach or entertainment. It is also a lot less crowded and much mellower than staying downtown. I definitely prefer staying close to Del Mar when in San Diego, and I am hoping I get this hotel again next time I Priceline a hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place but needs some attention”
Reviews.Author: chimera22
Reviews.Content: My husband, six year old son and I stayed her one night for a trip to SeaWorld (about 15 minutes south). The hotel is the typical nice Marriott I just found that it needed attention. The bedding was stained, the tables in the restaurant hadn't been cleaned properly etc. Little things but they bothered me. The staff was great however. There is internet access in the lobby for free. It also annoys me that there is a fee for internet access in the room. Parking is $16/nt. Torrey Pines beach is a 5 minute drive away. It's a nice hotel it just needs some care.

Reviews.Title: “loe this marriott”
Reviews.Author: sunshinesmile55
Reviews.Content: The Marriot Del Mar in San Diego was EXCELLENT. I loved it from the moment i walked into the hotel. Parking is a feel but you can find street parking around the corner. The outdoor patio bar is amazing! couches with a fire pit and outdoor heaters! it was so cute! the rooms were comfortable and clean. very nice and clean hotel!! i'm very particular about hotels and i rarely am happy with hotels but I LOVED THIS ONE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Marriott Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: hellokitty95
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to attend a training conference that my company arranged. Room was very clean and bed extremely comfortable. Had Bath Body Works aromatherapy amenities. No noise problems in room. Computer with internet/printer in lobby to print out boarding passes. Loved the ice water coolers with fresh fruit wedges in lobby and fitness center. Nice pool area with recliners and tables. Short drive to beach area. Self-garage parking with in/out $13/day.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: RozMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Del Mar as I had a business function near by. The food at the restaurant was good, rooms were nice with Bath and Body products, and I thought the outdoor lounge by the pool area was neat as they had gas fires that helped to heat up the place and it looked cool. The staff was very accommodating. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice little surprise!”
Reviews.Author: eva10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 night and we loved it. The hotel had really nice room with flat screen TVs, great beds. To my surprise the hotel had a very nice little gym, which supplied bottle water and towel, with access to and from the pool. All the equipment had they own headset and there were TV's all over. I was quite impressed for the location. The pool was big but not too deep, but it had the best beach chairs, nice cabanas with flat screen TVâ€™s as well as. This Marriott was a nice little surprise. It was right of the highway which was convenient, but I did not check out all the amenities before we booked so I was surprised to see all the things it had to offer. Even though it was not by the water I was a great place and nice amenities. The beach was only a few miles away. I would definitely stay here next time we go back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great bloody marys.”
Reviews.Author: xxuviolkd
Reviews.Content: We're having room service right now. Eggs Benedict has a distinctive Hollandaise sauce, which we enjoy, and the home fries are crispy on the outside/creamy on the inside. Bloody mary has a robust tomato flavor and is nicely spiced. The bar/lounge area was hip, lively and stylish. Very fun. The accommodations and service have also been above average. We would stay here again for the right occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: socalworldtrvler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights to go to the races at Del Mar. Loved it! Very nice rooms, comfortable beds. Plasma TV. Poolside bar was really fun. Definately would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Warm cookies & milk before bed”
Reviews.Author: HotelSnob40
Reviews.Content: A friend and I took our 7 year old sons to LegoLand last fall. She knew about this quiet business hotel that turned out to be wonderful. The rooms are clean, beds comfortable, and the restaurant is a cut above. I will go back just for the warm cookies and milk before bed.

Reviews.Title: “Singing the Praises of the Marriott Del mar”
Reviews.Author: JRZ_GYRL
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough great things about the San Diego Marriott Del Mar. It is a hotel of big city quality, nestled comfortably in the 'burbs. The staff was first-rate. The bed was decadently comfortable with a mountain of pillows and a marshmallow-soft down comforter. Other nice touches included a huge flat-panel TV, large workstation with high-speed Internet, and upscale toiletries. Very clean, too. The only thing I can muster a complaint about is the choice of towels. They were flimsy and somewhat worn. And the RESTAURANT! Yowza! Truly one of the most memorable hotel dinners ever--one that rivaled the finest restaurants in my home town of San Francisco. Arterra is an amazing find--to quote one reviewer, "I can't believe it's in the Marriott". On future travels to San Diego, this will be a destination restaurant for me. Try the Uva Uva Uva cocktail. Yum!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous MDM!!!”
Reviews.Author: AngelMel
Reviews.Content: I absolutely cannot believe the amazing value I received for this fantastic hotel on priceline.com. Granted, it's Priceline, which normally, you might not get so lucky, but in terms of hotel booking, it's great. The Marriott Del Mar was an extremely pleasant surprise, and I found out from one of the locals that it contains one of the best restaurants in the area. So naturally, I ordered room service, and had some fantastic sushi and nice salad. The reason I wanted to stay here was the famous Marriott bed. The room was clean, seemed relatively new, and very comfortable. The service was fantastic. They have a nice lobby area with computers lined up by the front desk, and a handy little convenience store. They offered the car service to me, and two wake up calls, which were nice touches. Though the hotel seems a bit out of the way from any sort of standard San Diego attractions, it was convenient for my purpose. I highly suggest staying here if you have business in that area, or if you don't mind driving around. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service/ Comfortable rooms /Great Value”
Reviews.Author: islandmann
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with 2 grandkids for the weekend. Although this is a business hotel and kinda far from downtown etc we very much enjoyed our stay. Great front desk staff, comfortable rooms nice gym with fruit and water, free interrnet in lobby to check email etc. Lobby is richly appointed and the overall rooms and facilities are very clean and nice. Did not use the restaurant till last day, was sorry we did not eat there every day. Breakfast was awesome!!! Definately one of the best breakfast buffet I have ever had, forget lowes, and Hotel del this was much better. Pool area was closed but they drove us over to the double tree where we spent all day sat! very nice pool area. Due to traffic flow we did all our travels up the coast to beach areas etc so great location for that. Would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mid_West_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights in March, 2007. I was completely satisfied. It is a very beautiful hotel and has an excellent, albeit expensive, restaurant. My room was really attractive, comfortable, clean, and quiet. The Marriott bedding is addictively comfortable. Service throughout my stay was excellent. Everyone was polite, professional, and well-trained. The location of the hotel is about 20 minutes north of downtown. There are numerous restuaruants in the area. It is a suburban office park environment, but if you have a car, it's easy to drive into San Diego. Parking was easy - - there's a garage connected by a sidewalk next to the hotel. It wasn't too expensive. It looked like renevations were about to begin on the pool area so if this is important to you, you might want to check on it. Overall, a great hotel and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, room and service”
Reviews.Author: ExecTO
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. Nothing to look at from the outside and there are no views to anything interesting but the hotel is real nice from the time you step into it. The check-in by professionally courteous staff are fast and friendly. There was a problem with my bill and they quickly apologized and corrected the error immediately. Nice gym facility with LCD screens with towel, water and fruits. Also they have a heated outdoor pool which I did not get a chance to use. All the rooms are appointed nicely including the bed, sheets, carpets, furniture, bathroom. Nothing to complain about at all. The restaurant is nice and serves a great buffet in the mornings. The bar to the side always seems to hopping with after work business types. My colleague tried the sushi they serve at the bar after hours and says its great. Nice facilities plus courteous professional staff made the stay pleasant and what I would expect from the Marriott. I suspect that almost if not all guests would be business types due to its location.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: nomadkate
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice, relaxing weekend at this hotel. The beds are comfortable and the fitness center is first class. The directions off of mapquest and priceline are wrong and I recommend contacting the hotel directly for instructions/map as it is east of the I-5 and not west. Parking is 13$/day and street parking is very limited (free) and hard to get after 6pm. This hotel was a bargain on Priceline and I didn't mind the fee for the night I couldn't park on the street. It isn't very scenic but is only about 5min drive to downtown Del Mar and the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Don't spend the extra money for Concierge level...”
Reviews.Author: amybic
Reviews.Content: I booked the Hotel Room Online and requested a Non-smoking room. The room reeked of smoke (it wasn't just a mild scent) so we requested another roomn and the staff said that they would be right up with another Hotel room key. We waited and waited and started to get ready for an event at the hotel and couldn't wait any longer. An hour later my husband called and told them we had to leave that we would keep the room. The Hotel staff knocked on the door 10 minutes latter with a deodorizer can. We were almost out the door and told them no thank you.....The service is really slow and unprofessional. Concierge level you pay more money, but the value is really poor. If I paid $60 off priceline it wouldn't really be so much of an issue. But the slow reaction and unprofessional response to a simple request (deodorizer spray) warrants poor marks.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing wrong with this hotel, but not a particualrily good value.”
Reviews.Author: Primula
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 3 nights and while we did not have an unpleasant experience, we also did not have a remarkable experience. The hotel was clean, the bed comfortable, the AC worked well and the hotel was quiet. However it was not that different from the BEST of the Hampton Inns. For the price we paid, I expected a more luxurious room. We stayed at another Marriott on Vancouver Island last year and for the same price, we really had a luxurious room, luxurious bedding, and a marble and granite bathroom. This one simply was not up to that standard. I thought the bar was quite expensive. For two glasses of wine, one mixed drink , two light , snack type meals, the tab was almost $100.00. There was no free access to a computer ( to print our airline boarding passes early) and even in the room the daily fee to plug in your own computer was 9.95 each day.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely LOVED the San Diego Marriott Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: ag00dw0man
Reviews.Content: I have to echo many of the other reviews on this hotel, and give the San Diego Marriott Del Mar the highest rating. The rooms are nice, and the location is fantastic, as it is an easy 20 minute drive to downtown San Diego. Plus, many of the other attractions, such as La Jolla Cove, Mission Beach, and Old Town are also within that same easy driving distance. The best part of the stay was the wonderful service. Two girlfriends and I were visiting San Diego for the long 4th of July weekend, and the friendliness and accommodation of the staff made our stay highly enjoyable. We were consistently greeted with enthusiastic, friendly smiles, whether it was early morning, or late evening after returning back to the hotel from a long day. On a daily basis, the staff helped us map out directions from the hotel to wherever our plans for that day would be taking us (this included local attractions, restaurants, and even our day trip to LA!) There was also a slight snafu with our access to the Concierge Level at the hotel, and the manager quickly responded and offered us complimentary buffet breakfast at Arterra, the awesome hotel restaurant. I would highly recommend the San Diego Marriott Del Mar. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay !”
Reviews.Author: tff
Reviews.Content: From the outside this hotel looks like an office building - it is in an office/business park area. However, it has a very modern look on the inside - the bar area and restaurant look very nice ($30+ entrees). We were quite happy with the hotel for our needs - very close to the highway (the 5) and grocery/shopping plaza near by down the street. Downtown Del Mar is 5-10 minute drive as is the Torrey Pines State Preserve. Downtown San Diego (and the airport) is about 20 minutes away. We were on the 4th floor facing office buildings so not facing the highway. It was not noisy at all. The room itself is a decent size. We had no problems with anything (except for the coffee pot which had not been cleaned since last use and was moldy). A call to the front desk rectified the issue quickly - we got a new one shortly. The pool area was nice - no attendant or pool-side services but plenty of lounge chairs and tables and chairs to have lunch at or whatever. We didn't spend much time at the hotel itself. The self-park is 11/day and valet is 16 or 17/day. This was a priceline hotel so we were very happy with it for the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business trip to Del Mar, and this hotel was only a half mile from the location he needed to be at. As it was just before our 33d anniversary, I decided to go to spend some time with him after his business was concluded. The hotel at first is very nice. It is, after all, mainly for business travelers. Our reservation was wrong upon check-in. They only had us there for 1 night instead of 3. We had a room on the 11th floor, concierge level, ($244 a night) which included a full breakfast daily, and appetizers and dessert at night. Our room was located by the elevator(shared wall), and across from the concierge lounge. Knowing how noisy that can be we tried to get our room changed, to no avail. The room was small, the bed average, and the view from the room was either the highway or the building next door. We tried a few appetizers that evening before looking for someplace to eat. Pretty average. The breakfast the next morning was just eggs, toast, mangled bagels, and sausage, fresh fruit. Not awful, just very average and not worth the exta money we spent that the business didn't cover. The appetizers and dessert in the evening were the same. No big deal. We've stayed at the Four Seasons Maui on the concierge level, and I can tell you there is a world of difference. I didn't expect the Four Seasons, but I did expect something better from the hotel and the reviews it got.To make it worse the air conditioning stopped working the day we had to check out. We reported it to the concierge, and they came back to our room to make sure we knew how to work it. Insulting, and no one ever showed up to fix it. Very hard to get ready to leave with the heat, and there are no windows that open. I'd look for someplace else before staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and near just about everything”
Reviews.Author: danelicious8
Reviews.Content: I was really happy with this hotel and my stay there. At first, I thought it unremarkable, from the outside to the pool. But after the first night, and with all the travelling we did, I ended up really appreciating how close it was to everything, how helpful and friendly the staff was, and how comfortable the beds were. The hotel is in a safe and pretty business and residential area. I felt very safe here. This building district was clean, nicely landscaped, and well lit. The residential neighborhoods were above average to high end. Beautiful flowers and landscaping abounded. We saw vegetation we wished we could grow in our backyard. I saw arbors, pergolas, climbing vines, it was a gardener's dream, and really added to the feel of the place. Casually elegant, lushly landscaped, a true coastal town. We were very close to a Plaza that had lots of stores and lots of casual dining options. We drove towards the Del Mar beach (maybe 5 mins at most) and took 13th street to Bullys for our first night. We had read from a guidebook that it was family friendly. It was . . . in a way. It was definitely a bar, and despite anti-smoke laws, it smelled of smoke and there were plenty of drinkers there. I wasn't comfortable here. It cost us $80 and without a doubt, the sirloin steak I had was delicious, but the atmosphere wasn't family friendly, the server was distant, and the sides were average to below average. My husband and I had opted for the steak and shrimp plate, and were each given 3 shrimp. The salad was a classic iceberg and the rice pilaf wasn't very good. There was a child menu the guidebook had promised, but for $5.95 the choices were chicken nuggets, hamburgers, and mac and cheese. We expected to pay high but we also expected to have good to excellent food. My daughter, who adores mac and cheese, couldn't eat more than one bite here. She's not a picky eater either. We ate brunch at IHOP at the Plaza after that, the only IHOP I had ever seen with mercedes, bentleys, and bmws parked in front. I am sure there were other family friendly restaurants nearby, but we were hard put to find them. There was a Red Robin in the plaza, and when we checked out the nearby La Jolla Marriott (it was very close to a shopping mall and restaurants there), we ate at Sammy's Fire Grilled Pizza. That was great. They had yummy salads, pizzas, and a good children'ts menu. Prices were $10 and up. Most restaurants we found were higher end electic sea food, fine dining establishments. Which is great, but not for a family vacation. We ended up eating also at the attractions we went to: SeaWorld, Legoland, and the Zoo. SeaWorld actually had a decent selection. The apple fries at Legoland were also pretty good. The Zoo was more expensive than SeaWorld, which surprised me. This Marriott has the new Marriott bedding, feather pillows, and feather comforter. It was extremely comfortable. We had two double beds, and they were the equivalent of a full size bed. I think it would be comfortable for two adults and two children, though just barely. There was a pool that from outside my window looked unremarkable, but we tried it out after a long day, and found the heated outdoor pool to have a comfortable temperature and to be very relaxing. It had two lap lanes roped off to one side. There was also a jacuzzi that was a nice respite as well. You can also rent a mini fridge, though there are no microwaves. We couldn't have driven more than 15-30 minutes to any of the attractions we wanted to see. We were going to stay downtown at the Marriott Marina towards the end of our stay for 2 nights for a local vibe, but just came back here. We were familiar with our way around, and found it to be more reasonable (parking elsewhere is $18 to $22, but here it was $11). It wasn't as crowded as downtown and I ended up being very pleased with it. There are fees for virtually everything (local calls, internet, etc.) but even with all of that, for a full service Marriott, this hotel or the La Jolla, would have been hands down much cheaper than downtown overall. I had wanted to tour Balboa Park, and peruse downtime, but there simply wasn't time for it. The people here are very friendly. If your trip to San Diego is more attractions oriented, I don't think you would be disappointed with this hotel. It is a great place to sleep, not noisy at all, and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: USBrits
Reviews.Content: Tastefully furnished - wonderful restaurant - great pool area - very comfortable beds. Marriott obviously put all their years of hotelling into this one - from the interior design (contemporary, not trendy, but way above traditional mid range fare - including 2 lounge areas, one with a fireplace), to the amenities, to the service, to the terrific food and excellent breakfast buffet. The only downside: our room overlooked I5: but the sound insulation was so good, you could stare at the freeway and watch the cars go past in almost total silence. 20 minutes into downtown San Diego may be off putting for some, but it was central for everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay.”
Reviews.Author: kimperc
Reviews.Content: Just returned (April 1st weeekend) from a stay at the San Diego Marriott Del Mar! We got a great rate for the area using our AAA card & usually expect to pay more in a hotel like this. The bed was sooo comfortable, the room was clean & the exercise room was pleasantly unexpected (able to get in 2 decent workouts) or you could easily jog down to Torrey Pines beach to enjoy an oceanside workout. I was disappointed that we had to pay for parking ($11/day to self-park), but that definitely won't deter me from staying there again when we travel back in August. I'm actually looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: LovetotravelSt.Louis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Marriott for one night (after a day in San Diego)...Hotel still looks new. The beds are extremely comfortable and the rooms are tasteful with bright colors...Have the hotel schedule a reservation at Jake's restuarant - great views where the ocean is illuminated at night. Hotel is close to Torrey Pines golf course and right off the highway - highly impressive for a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Super Rooms”
Reviews.Author: dr1ft3r
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided to spend our New Year's Eve in San Diego with friends from LA. We let our friends choose the hotel and they said the Del Mar was a nice place. The Marriott turned out to be an excellent hotel. Its proximity to downtown however is somewhat far. Figure 20-25 minutes drive to downtown SD. The room for the most part was excellent. The beds were extra comfortable, and my girlfriend loved the pillows and the down comforter. The bathroom was very spacious and the entire room was spotless. The rest of the hotel we didn't get to see much of as we spent most of our time partying in downtown, but from what I did see walking in and out, it seemed very classy. I would definitely stay here again, with my only caveat being location.

Reviews.Title: “Love the pillows”
Reviews.Author: PVHEREWECOME
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice.. Right off the I-5, about 20 minutes from DT. Rooms where clean and quiet. No complaints.. Loved the pillows, in fact, I found a website and bought 2 pillows!! The bar is very nice spent some time watching the Sushi chef prepare the sushi. This hotel is more in an Executive Park not many restaurants or night life near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: quanvon
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, payed $53 per night via priceline. Out of the 3 hotels we stayed at while visiting California, this was the nicest (Marriott Manhattan Beach was nice too, but this one was nicer). Stayed here a few nights since we were going to Legoland and the Wild Animal Park. Staff was friendly, hotel decor and rooms were very nice. There was a strip mall a few minutes away on Del Mar Heights and El Camino Real. The hotel charges $12/night for parking, but there's free parking at the back of the hotel (with no restrictions). Just keep driving on El Camino Real, pass the marriott and turn right on the next street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Decent Price”
Reviews.Author: photog72
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Marriott for 2 nights. We pricelined this hotel and got it for $60 per night. We were placed on the 3rd floor next to the vending machines. I didn't hear the vending machines at all. We were treated like we were paying full price. We didn't use the pool or hot tub or eat in the restaurant. There are plenty of choices within a couple miles of the hotel. Drive up Valley Centre Drive and you'll hit a few restaurants (including a Starbucks) or try the Mexican restaurant next door. Yes, you have to pay for parking. We were able to find street parking behind the hotel on Valley Centre Drive for free. It's hard to find during the day, but after 5-6pm, you can find parking there. We drove to downtown and the San Diego Zoo. Just make sure you go after rush hour if you are traveling south. I am looking forward to my next trip to San Diego. La Jolla is beautiful! A+ for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the marriott dorm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this marriott is literally right off of the 5 and from the highway it looks like a dorm or prison. which is a shame b/c inside is pretty nicely decorated. mostly business travellers given the locale near an office park or travellers who can't afford to be on the beach. i would never stay as a tourist as there is nothing vacation-like about it. perfect for business if you just want to go back to your room and order the marriott burger.

Reviews.Title: “Nifty little Marriott...”
Reviews.Author: JackSD
Reviews.Content: If you have business or activity virtually anywhere in the San Diego area, and especially in the North County, and you don't mind driving a few extra minutes to get where you're going, this hotel is a welcome respite from its competitors in the more congested La Jolla, Mission Valley or downtown areas. It's newer, brighter, and much more comfortable than the La Jolla Marriott, and cheaper to boot. Drive the extra minutes and be happier. One bonus of the location: it's only a 10-15 minute easy drive to Rancho Sante Fe, and if you're driving north to L.A. after your stay, you'll have a head start...

HotelInfo.Name: San Diego Marriott Del Mar
HotelInfo.Address: 11966 El Camino Real, San Diego, CA 92130
